bug.author: SirVectrex
bug.summary: Issue with installing streamlit on fresh python
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I have used streamlit happily for a month or two on my desktop machine and recently switched to a laptop. After installing PyCharm, VS Code and Python streamlit was the first to go. (Fresh setup) Same issues with a fresh virtual enviroment (venv) Thanks for the help! Unfortunately pip install streamlit throws a big error message <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
pip install streamlit <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Completed install <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Huge error message. (Follows) <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: Browser version:
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: command: 'c:\myvenv\scripts\python.exe' 'c:\myvenv\lib\site-packages\pip' install --ignore-installed --no-user --prefix 'C:\Users\flori\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-build-env-ny0h1s32\overlay' --no-warn-script-location --no-binary :none: --only-binary :none: -i https://pypi.org/simple -- 'cython >= 0.29' 'numpy==1.14.5; python_version<'"'"'3.7'"'"'' 'numpy==1.16.0; python_version>='"'"'3.7'"'"'' setuptools setuptools_scm wheel cwd: None Complete output (270 lines): Ignoring numpy: markers 'python_version < "3.7"' don't match your environment Collecting cython>=0.29 Using cached Cython-0.29.21-cp38-cp38-win32.whl (1.6 MB) Collecting numpy==1.16.0 Using cached numpy-1.16.0.zip (5.1 MB) Collecting setuptools Using cached setuptools-49.2.0-py3-none-any.whl (789 kB) Collecting setuptools_scm Using cached setuptools_scm-4.1.2-py2.py3-none-any.whl (27 kB) Collecting wheel Using cached wheel-0.34.2-py2.py3-none-any.whl (26 kB) Using legacy setup.py install for numpy, since package 'wheel' is not installed. Installing collected packages: cython, numpy, setuptools, setuptools-scm, wheel Running setup.py install for numpy: started Running setup.py install for numpy: finished with status 'error' ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: command: 'c:\myvenv\scripts\python.exe' -u -c 'import sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'C:\\Users\\flori\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\pip-install-050tohk5\\numpy\\setup.py'"'"'; __file__='"'"'C:\\Users\\flori\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\pip-install-050tohk5\\numpy\\setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' install --record 'C:\Users\flori\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-record-bzf1e11r\install-record.txt' --single-version-externally-managed --prefix 'C:\Users\flori\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-build-env-ny0h1s32\overlay' --compile --install-headers 'c:\myvenv\include\site\python3.8\numpy' cwd: C:\Users\flori\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-install-050tohk5\numpy\ Complete output (249 lines): Running from numpy source directory.

comments.comment:
Hm, looks like you're trying to build this on Windows, and numpy isn't installing.
error: Microsoft Visual C++ 14.0 is required. Get it with "Build Tools for Visual Studio": https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/
Do you know if those build tools are installed? Alternatively, perhaps using conda for your Python installation would allow you to work around this?

Sorry for the late reply - was out of office for a while Numpy is installed already: i executed pip install numpy and retrieved Requirement already satisfied: numpy in c:\users\flori\appdata\local\programs\python\python38-32\lib\site-packages (1.19.1) Installed Visual Studio as well - didnt help. Also I Visual Studio is not installed on my other computer. conda install streamlit is unfortunately throwing an error: package not available
I have now found the issue: Python was running as a 32bit version and the VS Build Tools still had to be activated. Thanks a bunch for the help!
I am having the same issue but can't fix it i tried...please help

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/samy0444>@samy0444</denchmark-link> -- can you verify that <denchmark-link:https://github.com/SirVectrex>@SirVectrex</denchmark-link> 's advice above does not work for you? We need a little more information about what you tried and what results you got.

Thanks I solved my error your comments helped me a lot. <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
On Sat, 5 Sep, 2020, 12:30 AM Naomi Most, ***@***.***> wrote: Hi @samy0444 <https://github.com/samy0444> -- can you verify that @SirVectrex <https://github.com/SirVectrex> 's advice above does not work for you? We need a little more information about what you tried and what results you got.
